197174.name: VIII Corps: The Somme 1916
197174.description:
Introduction
This is a two player card game covering the experience of the British VIII Corps on the first day of the Battle of the Somme, July 1st 1916. The game follows the course of the pre-battle preparation and the first day of the battle itself.

It is not a balanced game and one where the British will find it very hard to win.

Game Overview
To win the game the British player must capture two of the three German Support Lines. To do this they must overcome the First and Second Lines of defence in sequence before succeeding in attacking the final German line of defence.

The game is turn based. The early turns consist of just one phase solely concerned with strategic actions by both sides. Later turns consist of a strategic phase followed by a tactical phase. A tactical phase consists of British attacks, and the much rarer German counter-attacks, played in sequence.

The switch to multi-phase turns represents the end of the initial bombardment and the beginning of the infantry battle. The exact timing of the switch depends on whether the British player decides to prolong the pre-battle barrage or not.

Attacks, be they strategic or tactical, are made by playing a selection of cards. Strategic cards can only be played in the strategic phase and likewise tactical cards can only be played in the tactical phase. Furthermore, many strategic cards must be played immediately in the turn in which they are drawn so players do not have a totally free hand in deciding which cards to play.

The British player always takes the initiative unless the German player has chosen to counter-attack at the end of the tactical phase when the playing order is reversed.

Once the turn contains a tactical phase and the infantry battle has commenced, the British player must initiate at least one attack in every tactical phase. If they cannot attack, this counts as a failure. Only when the British have completed all their attacks may the Germans counter-attack.

To reflect the difficulties faced by the British on the day, the game ends with a German victory if two consecutive British attacks have failed. Failure to defend a German counter-attack does not count toward victory or defeat.

Plan your tactics carefully!

197175.name: Terrible Beauty
197175.description:
From publisher blurb:

Heed the Call of the Faerie Queen!

All across Urth stand doorways to hidden places. These are the realms of the faerie, entire worlds of magic and wonder, fear and horror. No friends to mortals, the faeries abandoned Urth long ago, leaving their homelands to humankind to do with as it wished. Now, with the Demon Lord’s shadow casting a pall across the land, the faeries have begun to return from their self-imposed exile, to join the fight against the darkness and purge the world of the evil that grips it. Terrible Beauty presents tools for players and Game Masters to introduce faerie stories, mechanics, and themes into Shadow of the Demon Lord campaigns. Inside, you’ll find:

The elf, hobgoblin, and pixie ancestries.
An assortment of new paths such as the Avowed expert path and the eternal guardian and troll hunter master paths.
The Fey tradition, and new spells for existing traditions.
Overviews of several sample faerie kingdoms.
New relics such as the Vorpal Sword and a new enchanted object table.
New creatures ranging from the fair nymph to the foul jabberwock.
A complete adventure for expert characters.




Terrible Beauty opens new doors to adventure and horror in a dying world, and the options presented here will leave your game forever changed!

rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
197176.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Level 6 Adventure on The Purple Planet for DCC RPG

When a legendary race of demonic beings pours out of the double-mooned sky and raids the party’s camp, events are set into motion that will lead them far southward to the equatorial region of the Purple Planet. Between the party and their destination lie air-ships and aerial combat, pirates and plunder, and the silver-spined Sky-Spire of the Sky Masters of the Purple Planet!

User Summary

You race your motorbike on curvy tracks using the directional buttons. There are power-ups and crashes.

197178.description:
In DIG, each player is a dog that will run throughout the Yard, dig up bones and attempt to return them to the matching colored Dog Bowl with the greatest efficiency. All players will score once, at the end of the game, based on the cumulative value of the Bones that he returned to the matching Dog Bowls.

There are 4 Bones in each of the 5 colors in the game. A Bone's value is determined at the end of the game, based on the distance of its corresponding Dog Bowl to the Dog House. The Dog Bowl that is closest to the Dog House will yield a value of 5 for each bone of that color. The Dog Bowl that is second closest to the Dog House will yield a value of 4 for each bone of that color, and so on. The Bowls and Bones will be swapped from the end of the Yard into the place of a recently dug up bone, continuously moving the 5 Bowls to the end of the Yard nearest the Dog House.

Each Yard Card has a Scent with 2 colors. The Bone on the opposite side of the Yard Card matches 1 of the colors of the Scent. This will help players determine which color Bone might be dug if that Yard Card is selected for digging.
One of the most interesting aspects of DIG is the unique "Leap Frog" Yard replacement mechanism. When a Bone is dug up, the Card that is furthest from the the Dog House, is removed and fills the empty spot created by the Dog. This action creates some interesting ways to influence which Bones and Bowls each Dog has close access to, but also makes timing critical for influencing Bone value for scoring.

On a player's turn, he may perform ANY or ALL of the following actions, but may only perform each action ONCE per turn.

MOVE: A player may move his Dog a maximum of 4 cards along the Yard Cards, and 1 less for each Bone he holds prior to movement. For example, if a player holds 2 Bone cards, he may move his Dog up to 2 Cards, moving below or above the Yard cards. A player may move his Dog in any direction. There is a movement legend on the bottom half of the Dog House for easy reference.

DIG: A player may dig up a bone and place the Bone card in his hand. Bones that are in the hand are kept secret until they are dropped off and placed in front of the player. The empty space created from the Yard Card removal is filled with the last Card at the edge of Yard. A player may have no more than 3 Bones in their hand at any time.

DROP: Drop a Bone into a Dog Bowl and place the Bone card from your hand to the playing area in front of himself, face up with the Bone visible to all players. A Dog must be AT the Bowl of the corresponding color in order to drop off any Bones of that color.

Game End and Scoring:
When Bowls are the only remaining Cards in the Yard (next to the Dog House), the game ends immediately and players total their scores. Any Bones still in a player's hand are removed from the game and do not count for scoring.

197179.name: Assano spel
197179.description:
"Assano" is a name under which several editions of Uno have been published in Europe, and also the name of this simplified Uno version given away by Quaker Oats to promote cereal products Havrefras and Rågfras.

The deck consists of 54 cards plus two rules cards. Compared to a regular Uno deck, this is missing zeroes and duplicates of suited cards, while the four +4 joker cards have been replaced with two +2 joker cards.

The rules are fairly short and ambiguous but can be interpreted to be largely consistent with regular Uno. Players are each dealt five cards and then try to empty their hands by making legal plays to the discard pile. There is no scoring: the goal is simply to shed your hand.

197180.name: Small Town Terrors: Galdor's Bluff
197180.description:
User Summary

Who is trying to sabotage the performance of Thurman the Magnificent, one of the world's greatest illusionists?

197181.name: Super Flippin' Phones

In Super Flippin' Phones, you flip phones out of people's hands to warn them about an impending disaster.

Snowfall will cover the city in snow or
glisten with rain thanks to a new in-game weather system. Citizens will be tested by the new challenges of running a city when the temperature falls. Snowplows will clear the streets, heating systems will run from home to home, and
new trams will shuttle citizens about town in an improved public transit interface.

e.g. Sand Storm & Forest Fire

Velociraptor

While a “veggie-saurus”, there are plenty of theories that this gigantic death-chicken was a nightmare for predators that tried to attack it. This species plays strong against aggressive cards and uses carcass cards to high effectiveness. When backed into a corner, the Therizi…Death-Chicken, can deliver severe punishment to their attacker but at a cost.

Dehumanize kids and make money.

197185.description:

Hone your DISC and CYCLE skills, then challenge the grueling STREAM program that throws endless combinations of modes and levels at you.

Quick thinking and clever tactics together for some planet conquering action.

Suchomimus playable Apex Deck (including the Stomping Grounds! ability)

197191.description:

Source: The Game Website.

197193.description:

Use it to solve our meticulously designed test chambers by painting the walls and droids. Remember how to mix colors from pre-school? Congratulations, you qualify!

Dub Dash is a fast-paced rhythm based action game including music from Bossfight and the DJs of Geometry Dash. Spin your crazy wheel in harmony with the song and keep dodging left and right avoiding obstacles at high speed. Do you rock the funky roads of Dub Dash?

Source: The Game Website.

Flip is a a puzzle game for your eyes and your brain. It has a simple and easy to understand mechanic, but the possible combinations on each puzzle will require deep thinking to solve them in the minimum number of moves. Play just to chill out or to exercise your brain.

Source: The Game Website.

197196.description:
Gurgamoth is a flying fighting game where the level is your weapon. Each match is lightning quick and focuses on intense flying combat and getting in your opponent's head. The controls are simple, but the mechanics and interesting levels bring out the game’s depth.

Source: The Game Website.

197197.name: Nebulous
197197.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.

Hack and slash your way through an army of monsters using Swordsmanship, Ninjitsu, pole sword, bow, and supernatural powers. Enhance your skills by defeating waves of enemies and slaying evil bosses lying in wait.

Source: The Game Website.

197204.description:

197205.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE

197207.description:
You've been elected as the new Bunker Warden! Now you must take control over a group of fellow bunker residents and try to make them last until the surface becomes habitable.

Join the CTU, arrest dangerous terrorist threats and use gadgets including the snake cam.

User Summary

Chaostower - Build and defend, a physics-based action puzzler.

videogamehonor: 2016 AGD Awards Excellence In Audio Honorable Mention
2016 AGD Awards Technical Excellence Nominee
197211.description:
Race brutal-cute aliens on exotic planets, using weapon powerups and physics-based vehicles to annihilate your competition in frantic round-based combat. Connect spare gamepads, laptops and smart devices as extra controllers.

Source: The Game Website.

197212.name: Tiny Troopers: Joint Ops
197212.description:
Tiny Troopers Joint Ops is an epic bite-sized arcade shooter, filled to the brim with action-packed mini maps of mayhem.

197213.description:
Talisman: The Horus Heresy is a digital board game based on the Talisman rule system and set in the Warhammer 40,000 universe, during the cataclysmic events of the Horus Heresy.

Source: The Game Website.

197214.name: Path of Exile: Ascendancy

User Summary

Path of Exile: Ascendancy is the fourth expansion for Path of Exile. The expansion introduces Ascendancy classes, Trials of Ascendancy, the Labyrinth and enchantments, in addition to several new unique items, divination cards, skill gems, and utility flasks.

197215.description:
Feelings Adrift is an amusement park with some plays. Each attraction have different environments and different goals. Some more scary than others but always with same intention, make good experience in game with scenes completely frightening.

Source: The Game Website.

197216.description:
From the instruction sheet:

Careful budgeting, though subject to unexpected events, is rewarded on Pay Day. ...The winner of BUDGET is the player who has the greatest wealth at the end of play."

197217.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE

Battle enemies in a fast paced, magic slinging, weapon smashing, all out medieval brawl! Overpower is easy to play and immediately fun. Choose a class, customize your loadout and join the ranks today!

Source: The Game Website.

197218.name: E.T. Armies
197218.description:
The game takes place in a future where Earth has been reduced to ashes; It is now home to a new nation that hungers only for war. Prepare yourself to rise and defend against the invasion of the Forsaken.

Source: The Game Website.

197219.name: Rhino's Rage
197219.description:
It is a turn-based tactical game, where you can accelerate and bunt enemies. There is a game mode for one player in different modes with own combat mechanics and characters with unique team roles are used in the game: pusher, stopper, tumbleweed and sprinter.

Source: The Game Website.

197220.name: The Artful Escape of Francis Vendetti
197220.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




Francis Vendetti has decided to become someone else entirely.

With his first show one night away, he embarks on a multidimensional journey to create his stage persona.

Source: The Game Website.

197221.name: Overfall
197221.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE

Explore the shifting seas of a strange realm. Fight challenging foes…or befriend them. Recruit lost souls and learn their histories. Take part in stories of the absurd and the tragic, the magical and the mundane - intimate, epic, and never the same twice in this fantastic strategy roleplaying game!

Source: The Game Website.

197222.name: Fragmental
197222.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




It’s a single screen, explosive arcade blast of fun where the weapons and levels are deadly and the rivalry is fierce.

Source: The Developer Website.

197223.name: The Sentient
197223.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Play as an A.I tasked with helping mankind explore the vastness of space. Customize your ship, recruit a crew, battle alien vessels, research new technology and explore randomly generated universes.

Source: The Game Website.

197224.name: Crazy Pixel Streaker
197224.description:
A Fresh and Insane Brawler with Roguelike elements. Lead a fellowship of jackasses abducted by angry aliens and forced to spread chaos into the most famous sports events.

Source: The Game Website.

197225.name: Acorn Assault: Rodent Revolution
197225.description:
Acorn Assault is a quirky, tail-bobbing turn-based strategy game. Raise an army, overthrow a tyrant King and save the oppressed squirrels in the Rodent Revolution!

Source: The Developer Website.

197226.name: Party Jousting
197226.description:
A one-button party game.

Source: The Developer Website.

197227.name: The Guest
197227.description:
'The Guest' is a gloomy adventure full of enigmas where the exploration of your surroundings comes to prominence; puzzles, secrets and riddles will help you discover who has locked you in this somber hotel room and most importantly, why.

Source: The Game Website.

197228.name: Caravanserail
197228.description:
User Summary

Caravanserail is a trading game. Buy, set a price, and sell.

197229.name: RePete
197229.description:
RePete is a pixel art puzzle platformer about time travel and self-cooperation. You play as Pete, a special guy that can loop back in time to help his past self solve problems, collect gems, and reach new heights.

Source: The Game Website.

197231.name: Das Berlin-Spiel
197231.description: A Monopoly-like boardgame, with typical Companies or Landmarks of Berlin.

197232.name: Dwarfbiter Family
197232.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gruesome Gangs is an exciting Pathfinder Roleplaying Game® compatible product line providing the Game Master with a collection of non-player characters (NPCs) designed to work together from the perspective of backstory, game mechanics, or both. The groups are presented at different Challenge Ratings to increase their utility for multiple gamers. In addition, this allows player characters (PCs) to encounter one of these groups early in a campaign and then again after both teams have gained experience with minimal extra work for the Game Master!

If the entire team is unsuitable for inclusion in the campaign at the time, then NPC stat blocks can be used individually as needed. A mixed approach can also be interesting. By introducing a single foe into the campaign, this product gives a number of friends or allies that foe could call upon after running afoul of the PCs! This gives the Game Master a ready-made answer to who would the NPC go to for assistance, or even who would come to avenge his death at the hands of the PC party!

Using This Product

This product presents the overall history of the NPC team as well as the backstory for each individual member of the gang.

Each NPC has four stat blocks (CR 4, CR 9, CR 14, and CR 19) demonstrating his progression and growth over time. As a visual indicator, the color of the name bar designates which stat blocks from each NPC are of equivalent Challenge Rating along with the CR text.

Composition

Each gang is comprised of multiple members which can include a mixture of races, class levels, and templates. This section helps the Game Master compare different gangs’ capabilities and make-up at a glance without having to review each stat block.

Team Members

Ingerd Dwarfbiter – CE female thicken ogre
Muzzug Dwarfbiter – CE female troggle
Rumblegut Dwarfbiter – CE male stoneblood giantkin ogre
Runt Dwarfbiter – CE male ogrekin orc
Skarrok Dwarfbiter – CE male thicken ogre




Team Summary

Composed of ogres and half-ogres, this gang is very melee-capable even with the shaman and sorcerer members due to the sheer size and strength advantage of the races. The group layers rogue and slayer abilities to further the melee devastation. The addition of a rock-throwing ranged specialist and earth elemental sorcerer makes them a threat at any distance. The team rounds out with a powerful battle shaman capable of enhancing combat abilities and healing injuries.

The group has several advantages designed to fight against dwarves specifically; however, many of these are easily tailored to any other race. As befits ogres, they are motivated by hunger and include members capable of turning defeated enemies into a delicacy. Their voracious hunger and desire for various exotic foods provide one of many hooks for bringing this gang into a campaign.

197234.name: Infinite Threats 07
197234.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need a few alien critters to kill off in your Infinite Futures Games? Are your players bored with blasting droids and robots? Avalon is offering you new threats for your team to encounter, where each menace is a fully detailed creature, usable as part of the Fringe setting or in any game you are running.

Explore the danger of space with new threat expansions released for the Infinite Futures system.

197235.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 5, Issue 12 - AvarTech)
197235.description:
From publisher blurb:

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue offers a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Masks system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

This week: Science can be used for good or bad, but what happen when the scientist just does not care.

197236.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 5, Issue 13 - Under the Waves)
197236.description:
From publisher blurb:

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue offers a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Masks system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

This week: What do the heroes do when they get a call for help, but from under the ocean waves?

rpg: Demon Hunters: A Comedy of Terrors
197237.name: Demon Hunters: A Comedy of Terrors
197237.description:
Vampires infesting the mayoral office. Lycanthropes prowling the suburbs. Another kraken making its way upstate along the river. Crazed cultists masquerading as door-to-door religious nuts. Every one of them edging the world one more step toward the next demonic apocalypse. In your line of work, that’s called Tuesday.

You are an agent of the Brotherhood of the Celestial Torch, hand-picked to serve as Earth’s first and last line of defense against the servants of Darkness. Oh sure, there are others in the Brotherhood who seem more hand-picked than you were, and yes, you probably only work out of a small office somewhere in Michigan or Wyoming or South Dakota, but when it comes to dealing out the damage to the infernal instruments of Hell taking over that shopping mall or the Craz-E-Mart, the buck stops with you. Lock and load, baby.

This book—packed with tabletop roleplaying rules based on the Fate RPG system has everything you need for playing Demon Hunters and creating badass adventures so they can strut their stuff. Produced as a result of a highly successful Kickstarter project, it’s got random charts, monster stats, examples, illustrations, page numbers, and a ton of fancy words. But best of all, it’s got you and your imagination to kick off one hell of a good time.

(from the back of the book)

197238.name: Treasure of the Cruel Captain
197238.description:
A coin as a game board? Why not explore numismatics in a playful way! Roll the dice now and find the "cruel" captain’s treasure.

Two players of all ages can now both try their luck on this unique board game on a coin.

The determined treasure hunter starts in a pirate ship and rolls the dice in order to reach the "cruel" captain’s treasure on the bottom of the ocean as quickly as possible. In doing so, it is necessary to overcome obstacles and above all, have fun!

197239.name: MagNets: Fully Charged
197239.description:
Polarity City is under threat: the Bloxbots have gone rogue! Usually rather stupid, Polarity City's favourite maintenance cubes have suddenly become dangerous. Far from fixing things, the Bloxbots are destroying everything in sight... and why do they even HAVE lasers, anyway?

Source: The Publisher Website.

197240.name: Swords & Six-Siders Gamemaster's Book
197240.description:
From Introduction:

Running a Game of Swords & Six-Siders

The first thing to remember about running a game of Swords & Six-Siders is that it is a game. Rules are merely a means to an end. If you or your players aren’t having fun, then change it!

197241.name: Blast 'Em Bunnies
197241.description:
Defend your burrow from a horde of evil bunnies!

Pick them off using your carrot rifle, pelt their furry hides with your watermelon pip machine gun or wreak havoc with your runner bean laser. Want to destroy as many of their colony as possible? Your turnip mortar will do maximum splash damage.

Source: The Developer Website.

197242.name: Swords & Six-Siders Player's Book
197242.description:
From Introduction:

"Unsheathe your swords, ready your spells, and watch your step, for dragons do not yield their loot willingly!"

Swords & Six-Siders is a fantasy role-playing game inspired by the works of Gary Gygax, Dave Arneson, and Ken St. Andre. This is a rules-lite game of dungeon exploration and fantasy adventure, and only uses six-sided dice. All that is needed to play are the Player & Game Master books, pencil and paper, six-sided dice, two or more players, and your imagination.

197243.name: Casey Powell Lacrosse 16
197243.description:
Featuring in-depth lacrosse gameplay, high quality graphics, multi-year career mode, competitive online multiplayer, real-time RPG leveling and character customization, Powell Lacrosse 16 brings the sport to life like never before.

Source: The Developer Website.

197244.name: Case #8
197244.description:
User Summary

You are a prisoner in a deep underground prison. Your only option is escape, but can you make it and get out?

197245.name: Robo's World: The Zarnok Fortress
197245.description:
Take on the vast, interconnected Fortress, and battle an ever learning foe who seeks to repair each zone you sabotage. Can you master your abilities to put an end to the dark reign of the Zarnok once and for all?

Source: The Game Website.

197246.name: Senran Kagura: Estival Versus
videogamehonor: 2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Heroine of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best PlayStation Exclusive Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Song of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Hottest Gal of the Year Nominee
197246.description: It is the seventh game in the series, and the sequel to Senran Kagura: Shinovi Versus.

197249.name: Heroes Reborn: Enigma
197249.description:
Heroes Reborn: Enigma is a first-person action-adventure video game based in the Heroes universe. Taking place primarily in 2008, Enigma serves as a prequel to Heroes Reborn. Dahlia, the main character, is also able to time shift to 2014.

Play 32 levels and continually evolve, as your powers and abilities increase throughout the game. Harness your powers of time shifting, telekinesis and time manipulation to survive. But, it will take real skill to escape where you are being held hostage and save your sister.

Sources:
The Game Website.
The Publisher Website.

197250.name: The creamy dreamy skate adventure
197250.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.





A work in progress game about the strange adventure of a girl and her skateboard. The spots are based on real-life skate-places of my country, Nicaragua, where i used to go.Source: The Game Website.

197252.name: Pharaoh Rebirth+
videogamehonor: 2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Indie Game of the Year Nominee
197252.description:
An ancient evil has been set loose, and Jonathan cursed in the process. Jonathan must now collect seven holy grails from around all of Egypt to cleanse himself of the curse of Sehur the first. Be delighted by the quirky humor, charming characters, and the beautifully designed world, in Pharaoh Rebirth+!

Source: The Developer Website.

197253.name: Royal Heroes
197253.description:
Welcome, my Lord, to the cursed kingdom. A land plagued by black magic and creatures that crawl out of the darkness. Once this was a great kingdom. It could be great again. That's all up to you. Enter the world of Royal Heroes - a strategy game set in a world of fantasy and adventure.

Source: The Publisher Website.

197254.name: Chesster
197254.description:
Chess meets match-three to create a deep and strategic new experience. Faced with a board full of chess pieces, you must create rows or columns of matching pieces to score points. Pieces move the same way as in chess and “take” the piece in their target destination, clearing it from the board.

Source: The Game Website.

197255.name: War Birds: WW2 Air strike 1942
197255.description:
War Birds is a 2.5D World War 2 air combat game, with impressive 3D warplanes and beautiful 2D environments.

Source: The Publisher Website.

197256.name: Prison Run and Gun
197256.description:
User Summary

The recent events in a state prison, involving Jake and the others, was a perfect moment for some prisoners to escape.

197257.name: Dynetzzle Extended
197257.description:
Dynetzzle is an original number puzzle game based on the features of a standard six sided die.

Source: The Game Website.

197258.name: Sparkle ZERO
197258.description:
Many organisms fight for resources and the opportunity to evolve. Be one of them, start from ZERO and become the best, the biggest and the most efficient of them all. Become the ultimate sparkle.

Source: The Publisher Website.

197259.name: Just Cause 3 - Sky Fortress
197259.description:
Just Cause 3: Sky Fortress is the first PDLC pack from the Air, Land & Sea Expansion pass. Become the master of the skies with Rico's all new and fully armed, Bavarium Wingsuit. Save Medici from the threat of the terrifying Sky Fortress and its army of deadly robotic drones.

This content pack includes new missions, challenges, the "Bavarium Splitter" assault rifle and the "Eviction" personal defence drone, all of which can be carried over into the main game.

Source: [https://justcause.com/# The Game Website].

197260.name: EA Sports UFC 2
videogamehonor: 2016 CVA Best Animation of the Year Nominee
2017 D.I.C.E. Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
197260.description:
The game's artificial intelligence accommodates for changes in player strategies mid-game to make the gaming experience more realistic than in previous UFC games. The game also simulates "full body deformation" to connect players with their player-character.

Source: Wikipedia, "EA Sports UFC 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

197261.name: Premium Pool
197261.description:
Premium Pool is a smooth and enjoyable way to play billiards on your computer.

Source: The Developer Website.

197262.name: Dragon Fantasy: Book II
197262.description:
User Summary

Dragon Fantasy: The Black Tome of Ice is best described as the director’s cut of the game previously titled Dragon Fantasy: Book II.

197263.description:
Picking up where the adventures in the Return of Valandor left off, this quest pack contains additional components which allow you to explore the next chapter of the epic Dungeon Saga storyline.

In Infernal Crypts, join the quest to retrieve the Fire Lotus - a rare flower which legend has it grows on lava flows deep in the heart of the Abyss. It is said the nectar from just one such plant can cure any malady – even reverse the effects of death itself. You will be guided by the mysterious wizard Furial, potion maker extraordinaire from the Order of the Shrouded Sceptre. As your patron, he has constructed a spell that will transport you instantly to the outer reaches of this fiery domain, where you must prepare to face horrors unimagined.
197263.name: Dungeon Saga: The Infernal Crypts
boardgameaccessory: Dungeon Saga: Denizens of the Abyss Minatures Set
Dungeon Saga: Legendary Heroes of the Crypts

197264.name: Clockwork (2013)
197264.description:
User summary:

This intriguing game utilizes a mechanic known as "Tick Tock", in keeping with the title and thematic elements. Each turn consists of a Tick for each player, and the turn concludes with a Tock. During the Tick, a player gains narrative precedence and another player assumes the role of adversary (essentially, a game master function). When the Tick concludes, play passes to another player. After all players have executed a Tick, all players experience the same Tock event - when various actions conclude in the game.

197265.name: Bug Rush
197265.description:
Dinner is served and BUG soup is on the menu in Bug Rush! This is a Tower Defense game with a floral theme and you control a selection of carnivorous plants that must stop the bug invasion in the garden. Create plant mazes and watch the bugs get squashed. Not for the faint-hearted!

Source: The Publisher Website.

197266.name: Conjunct (2013)
197266.description:
User summary:

This rules-light game utilizes a dice pool mechanism for action resolution. All characters are hatched "Var" larvae. Character creation atypically involves circulating images of larvae and identifying likely traits from the images. Most "Var" larvae have considerable supernatural powers, telekinetic and psychic abilities being typical.

197267.name: Race to the Top Australian Edition
197267.description: Race to the Top puts your knowledge of every imaginable subject to the test as you scramble to climb to the highest level of the pyramid. You are in complete control of your fate, choosing the category and level of difficulty for each trivia question you answer. But be careful - your opponents will try to knock you off the pyramid!

197268.name: Pilot Brothers
197268.description:
The case of the stolen elephant! Elephant... Rare... Striped. ...has been kept for many years by an animal trader named Karbophos. Being unable to overcome abuse, it escaped and found a home at the zoo in our city. This is definitely Karbophos's work. To the zoo!

A provincial Russian town has been shaken in disbelief: their prized, rare, striped elephant, Baldakhin, disappeared from the zoo in the dead of night. The main suspect is its notorious former owner, Karbofoss. Two well-known detectives, the Pilot Brothers, set up a new investigation, pursuing the rogue through 15 comic-style locations to find the missing elephant. Sensible Brother Chief and his not-so-bright assistant, Brother Colleague, solve tricky puzzles and play their parts with precise timing in this humorous adventure game for the whole family!

● 15 Increasingly difficult levels to solve
● 2 Different characters: Brother Chief and Brother Colleague
● Fast-paced, arcade mini-games and loads of absurdly witty mini-games!
● Join the famed duo in their search for the elusive thief!

User Summary
Sound and text/UI:
English, French, German, Italian, and Russian

Only text/UI:
Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Portuguese (Brazilian), Spanish

boardgamecompilation: Im Wandel der Zeiten: Das Kartenspiel
197269.description:
The world is a dynamic place, always changing and never stops flowing. New and improved ways are challenging traditional values and, with the wave of renaissance sweeping through, you will not be spared.

With great power comes great responsibility to provide stability and protection, resulting in a new golden age. Endure the tides of time, and leave an epic impression of your civilization upon the heritage of mankind.

Guns & Steel: Renaissance is a standalone expansion for Guns & Steel, providing new cards and new mechanisms that can be played by itself, or combined with the base game to provide a rich and dynamic adventure throughout history. Here's the overview of a player's turn during the game:


Resource Phase
Play a card face-down as a resource card.

Development Phase
Play a card face-up as a development card.

Purchase Phase
May buy one card from supply.

End of Turn Phase
0 or 1 card in hand:
Retrieve cards to hand.

2 or more cards in hand: Do nothing.
Check if you can place glory cubes on a wonder.



The game ends when all of the wonders are taken, or when all space age cards have been bought, or when a player has 15 VP tokens. At this point, whoever has the most VP wins.
197269.name: Guns & Steel: Renaissance

197270.name: Kingmaker
197270.description:
There was no king in the serene republic of Venice, but every year one was chosen. During the carnival at the Doge`s palace the masked ball of the false king was held. At the ball a courtly game of blind man`s buff was played where the winner was crowned king for the evening.

In this nine card nanogame players position character cards around one card in the middle of the table and guessing each others play try to become the Kingmaker and thus win the game.
The Fool will jest, the Minstrel will dance and the Courtisan… erhm prefers touch.

197271.name: ozaiko - a radially different puzzle
197271.description:
User Summary

In dry, formal terms, Ozaiko is a “radial sliding photo puzzle game". Less formally, it is a subtle mix of one part game, one part toy, and one part meditation experience with some very nice photos, music and unique gameplay features.

197272.name: Tallowmere
197272.description:
Indulge Lady Tallowmere and see how far through her lovingly violent dungeons you can delve in this 2D indie action roguelike-inspired platformer.

New rooms are procedurally generated every time you play.

How far can you make it?

Source: The Game Website.

Developed by Chris McFarland.

197273.name: Space Elevator
197273.description:
From publisher blurb:

Space elevators are a great addition to a sci-fi role playing game. Most inhabited planets will have one or more dotted around the equator, providing an alternative way of leaving the planet with a surprising number of advantages compared with an orbital shuttle. A journey to orbit on a space elevator takes a few days, so it makes an ideal location for a short, self-contained adventure.

This supplement describes common space elevator designs and adds some floor plans and adventure ideas.

197274.name: Kineticist and Occultist Feats
197274.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kineticists manipulate the primal matter and energy of the universe with the power of their minds, while occultists tap into the latent mystic energies inherent within everyday objects and foci. Characters of both kinds can unleash the power within with 12 new mythic feats from Parting Blast and Strong Implement Link to Kinetic Leap and Interweave Composite Blast!

197275.name: The Witch Hunter V (Hybrid Class)
197275.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new hybrid class combining the martial arcane finesse of the magus with the drive and determination of the inquisitor. An original concept by Adam Matherly, this version of the witch hunter focuses on dispelling and disrupting the arcane acts of others.

197276.name: Feats of Ferocity
197276.description:
From publisher blurb:

The More Feats! PDFs introduce a single page of themed feats for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Every PDF contains a full page of high-quality content (no fluff or filler)!
Feats of Ferocity features feats for enthusiasts of savage and vicious fighting styles who want to add options to their actions: Blood Reveler, Brutal Aggression, Chomp, Enduring Ferocity, Frightfully Invincible, Improved Brutal Aggression, Lingering Stench, Overpowering Stench, Savage Vitality, Surging Spell Resistance, and Webhunter!

197277.name: Obsidious
197277.description:
From publisher blurb:

Witness the Dark Reflections of… Obsidious!

A Power Level X Rogue, Obsidious is an undying evil being who delights in confronting people with their own dark sides. Obsidious is an iconic character in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

Obsidious’s file is designated "Black" to reflect his strange, occult origins. Is he a god? A cosmic entity from another world? Or is he a servant of powers even more terrifying that lurk beyond the worlds we know? No-one knows for certain, but his evil nature is unquestionable. On his own, he is a Power Level 16 threat, but the powers within his mystic Black Mirror grant him abilities that defy quantification. Chief among these powers is his ability to confront heroes with dark reflections of themselves, manifestations of their own dark sides given physical form! Can your heroes defeat themselves and foil the plots of Obsidious?

197278.name: And One For All
197278.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s a time and a place made for swashbuckling adventure. France has a weak king, a barren queen, a wicked first minister, a splintered populace, and enemies on every side. Into that breach step the men of the King’s Musketeers. Brave men to be sure, but brave in a foolhardy way that you can’t help but admire, even as you shake your head in disbelief. Still, thank God for them, because it’s going to take a fool like that (or a company of them) to save the crown and the nation’s honor!

And One For All is a sourcebook for games inspired by The Three Musketeers, designed for use with the QAGS Second Edition rules. It includes extensive setting information, combat rules, GM tips, a complete sample adventure (“How the Musketeers Stole Christmas”), invaluable appendices, Combat Cards, and more!

All for one. One for all!

197279.name: BASH! Fantasy: Grimoire of Magic
197279.description:
From publisher blurb:

The BASH! Fantasy: Grimoire of Magic was originally conceived to be a "12-page no-frills PDF of magical spells". We've gone beyond that; adding some nice artwork and expanding the content to 30 pages.

Inside you get:

Dozens of new Enhancements and Limitations for your magical powers to make them customized and unique.
A magic system divided into seven "Colleges" of Earth, Fire, Air, Water, Light, Shadow, and Nature, as well as Universal Spells everyone can use. Each college has its own list of spells. You can also opt to use "Hedge Magery" for characters that don't want to commit to specific Colleges.
Alternative options for Magical Healing
EPIC Spells: Spells of such power and renown that only the most powerful spellcasters ever unlock their secrets. Unleash magic that can defy death itself, or make your wishes come true.
An alternative magic system called "Spellcraft" which allows you to cast spells on a daily basis rather than expending Energy. This can be used as a supplement to, or a replacement for, the existing magic rules.
A guideline to research and create new spells of your own.

197280.name: Diceplomacy
197280.description:
The theatre of Europe is about to go up in the flames of war. You are the leader of your people. Use your diplomatic skills and luck of the Iron Dice to secure victory.

Diceplomacy is a simple, yet strategic dice game of war and diplomacy with the flavour of World War 1.

The game has the war, alliance-making, secrecy, bluffing, and luck, etc. that people love from complex strategy games, but in Diceplomacy you only need 1 die per person, it is easy to learn, and a game takes only about 20 minutes.

Quick game overview:
Each player rolls one die, to determine their Power, and keep their die hidden.

On your turn, you can do 1 of the following 4 things: Declare war on another player, propose an alliance with another player, cancel all alliances, or reroll your Power die

If you declare war on another player - the one of you with highest Power scores a Victory, and the other a Defeat.

The goal of the game is to get 3 Victories.
If a player is defeated 3 times, he is out of the game.

197281.name: Mystery Men! Second Edition
197281.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mystery Men are back - and they're better than ever!

First published in 2011, Mystery Men! is a rules lite game about crime fighting super heroes. It includes simple rules for generating super characters and guiding them through adventures, with rules for heroic feats and combat. The game also includes a guide to creating settings and a full sample setting called Shore City, a sample scenario and 24 heroes and villains. Best of all, it is broadly compatible with many old school games.

197282.name: The Horror of Hill Stead
197282.description:
From the publishers description:

This adventure module is designed for characters of levels 4 to 8 using the original game rules of 1974, and 1975-76 supplemental handbooks. It includes maps of a partial wilderness, a 3-level keep-like structure, description matrixes, encounter tables and background information, as well as a party of pregenerated characters for players to use when exploring the locations provided.

197284.name: Corked: The party game for the entertaining connoisseur
197284.description:
From the publisher:

A crazy twist on classic charades. Two players must work together to act out separate clues that the crowd must combine to get the correct guess. Every player plays on every turn and no one ever performs alone. 2-person teams change constantly.
This game requires quick thinking and spontaneous creativity. The scoring is every man/woman for himself/herself in the end, but the crowd can influence both the score and the pace of the game. There is constant hilarious action and interaction. It's super easy to learn.

The game comes in a wine tote bag because the makers of the game think wine makes game nights better, and you may want a spot to put your bottle. It also makes for a great gift. This is not a "drinking game", nor does it have "adult content." It just comes in a different type of package than most party games.

197285.name: Merchants & Marauders: Broadsides
197285.description:
Set in the Merchants & Marauders universe, Broadsides is a standalone game in which the two opposing players command pirate ships engaged in a fierce battle over a profitable sea lane. Sinking the enemy or taking out their Captain and First Mate are the only ways to seize victory and survive the day!

The card-driven game system allows players a wide variety of actions, triggered by playing cards in a variety of combinations.

Aim: zero in your cannons using an innovative targeting system
Hold: Draw more cards to increase your versatility
Reload: Load a variety of ammunition types (chain shot for rigging, canister for crew, solid shot for hull) into a variety of cannons (reliable 18-Pounders, thunderous Carronades, deadly Long Nines)
Broadside: Blast all your cannons at once in a fierce but costly salvo
Sheer Off: Correct your course just enough to disrupt your foe's plans
Repair: Send sailors where they are needed to man the guns, patch the hull, or replace ruined sails

Additionally, your Captain's unique Reputation and a handful of drafted Dirty Tricks means that every matchup will be different from the last. Multiple tactical approaches to either of the win conditions means that you can tailor your gameplay to your strengths and your foe's weaknesses. Outthink, outplay, outgun, and sail away the winner!

197289.name: Speed Demon (Supers!)
197289.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a good guy gets down on his luck, he finds a way to pick himself back up. When a guy like Max has a streak of bad luck, he makes a deal with the Devil. Max's life has never been the same since the night he got his unearthly speed. Unfortunately, like most things in Max's life, terms and conditions apply.

197290.name: Backstab (Issue 32 - Jul 2001)
rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (2nd Edition)

197291.name: ASTROKILL
197291.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Pilot spacecraft ranging from small, nimble fighters to heavily armed gunships. In ASTROKILL, you will engage in combat against enemy fighters, capital ships, turrets, and even space mines. To succeed in this unforgiving zero-G battlefield, you must master your ship and its weapons. You will blow away spaceships with machine guns, flak cannons, and homing missiles. Your Gravity Shield will protect you from enemy fire and even turn their weapons against them.

Campaign and Survival mode
Pick a faction and enter the fray in either a story-driven Campaign mode or an arcade-style Survival mode. In Campaign mode, you will fly missions within the context of a faction-specific storyline. With each passing mission, you will discover new enivornments, characters, ships, and challenges that test your skills as a fighter pilot. If stories aren't your thing and you just want an endless blood bath, then there is Survival mode. Like an old-school arcade game, you must fight and survive wave after wave of progressively more difficult enemies. Fight to beat your own top score or attempt to dethrone the number one player on the Steam leaderboards.

Weapons
In ASTROKILL, battles are fought with conventional weapons, like belt-driven machine guns, proximity-based flak cannons, and Javelin-style guided missiles. When it comes to inflicting damage downrange, nothing is quite as effective as high-velocity metal slugs. The kinetic energy behind a 30mm bullet travelling at 600m/s is tremendous (about 68,000 Joules). If that's not enough, flak cannons fire explosive projectiles that detonate near enemy fighters, doing area damage. Homing missiles track fighters and attempt to intercept them and detonate within their kill radius. If a missile misses its intended target, it will reassess the battlefield and track a new target.

Source: The Game Website.

197292.name: Backstab (Issue 33 - Sep 2001)
197292.description:
Backstab
Nombre 33
Septembre 2001

Nouveau: Cahier d20!
32 pages de scénarios et d'aides de jeu pour D&D3

197293.name: Randomiser-o-Rama
197293.description:
From the publisher:

A quick new zine-sized thing for fantasy RPGs, a collection of random tables, system agnostic, from history, myth and my own gameworld, stuffed with ideas to spur your own creativity. 24 pages plus cover, featuring:
- How to protect your town;
- Just what did kill all the villagers?
- Places worth exploring;
- Contents of a wizard's knapsack;
- What has it got in its pocketses, eh?
- Snakes, why'd it have to be snakes?
- Protective amulets;
- Things to find on a blasted heath;
- It's a workshop, but what kind of work?
- Twenty pieces of hacksilver;
- Oathsworn to vengeance;
- Curious effects resulting from the consumption of various subterranean arthropods;
- and last but not least, Inn Names Generator #652.

197294.name: The Castle that Fell from the Sky
197294.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Castle that Fell from the Sky is a classic fun-house tournament dungeon, combining hack-n-slash, tricks, traps, puzzles, and roleplay elements. It is designed for a party of six 3rd level characters, and to be run in a 6-9 hour game slot. The adventure comes in at 40 keyed encounters, 32 pages, plus a loose, hand-drawn map, and features numerous non-standard monsters.

197295.name: Hyperspace Messenger Compendium
197295.description:
From publisher blurb:

Stunners. Robots. Aliens. Skills. Vehicles. Cyberware. Star Sectors. There is a lot of sci fi goodness packed into the 80 pages of this book. Whether you are a player or a Referee, this compendium will add a lot of fun to your White Star role-playing experience!

The Hyperspace Messenger is a series of short supplements designed for use with the White Star role-playing game, though it uses simple conepts which can easily be integrated into any OSR-style science fiction game. This compendium merges six Hyperspace Messengers into one book for easy use at the gaming table, plus adds a seventh chapter containing a Star Sector generation process that quickly builds the foundation for a campaign setting for you and your players to tell your spacefaring tale of daring adventure.

197297.description:
Battle for Moscow II is played on a map of the former Soviet Union where the battle was fought.

It uses playing pieces that represent the actual military units that participated in this campaign. Each player represents a General commanding an Army Group of troops (for the Germans) or a Front of Soviet Armies. The individual German ground units represent corps (from the Latin word "corpus," meaning "body") of approximately 25,000 soldiers and what was left of their equipment after the long drive across western Russia in the summer of 1941. The Soviet ground units are mostly armies of approximately 40,000 men each, with a few cavalry and airborne corps of about 10,000 men each.
197297.name: Battle for Moscow II

197298.description:
Description from the publisher:

War has come to the World of Indines. As the Mercenary King Gerard Matranga makes his bid to become the absolute ruler of Relecour, the fearful barons lock themselves away in fortresses of ancient stone. Mercenaries from across the world take to the field of battle, waging a proxy war on behalf of their opulent masters.

Take control of one of the Mercenary Companies of Indines in Ballistic Reign and put your mastery of battlefield strategy to the test! Build great siege engines, cast powerful war magic, and erect impenetrable fortresses on the field of battle. Use your workers carefully to balance between maintaining your forces and manning the units and structures you build. Invest your time in spell research, economic development, defense, and offense by working together and against other mercenary companies and capturing neutral locations in your campaign. Only the shrewdest tactician will be able to conquer their foe and bring peace to Indines once more!

Play as ten different Mercenary companies from the World of Indines universe, each with their own weapons, spells, and leader! Recruit from over seventy different units and strongholds to build your forces!
197298.name: Ballistic Reign

197299.name: Thunderclap
197299.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible vehicle. The vehicle introduced in this installment of the series is a heavily armed, ultraheavy Rocketplane.

The PDF contains the background of the vehicle and statistics for its use as well as an illustration.

197300.name: Black Sheep NPC Codex Vol 2
197300.description:
From publisher blurb:

"After all, the wool of the Black Sheep is just as warm" - Ernest Lehman

Black Sheep NPC Codex Provide 6 NPCs with brief backstories for use in any Pathfinder Role Playing Game. What makes the Black Sheep interesting is that they play against their normal type. In Vol. 2, we meet some dragons, some intelligent constructs, and Desmond's Hand- a cheeky undead hand.

6 NPCs for any Pathfinder RPG
6 boons, to reward players with

197301.name: Backstab (Issue 35 - Nov 2001)
197301.description:
Backstab
Nombre 35
Novembre 2001

Lux Draconis: Une campagne à faire pâlir Dragonlance!

197302.name: Verses
197302.description:
Verses is a real-time, Biblical card game that helps players to organically memorize scripture amongst all the fun.

Each card in Verses shows either a verse from the Bible or a reference to a verse. In real-time, players search to add matching verse and reference cards to their hand to score them. If players are able to recite the scripture from memory as they score it, they gain additional points.

Players require the minimum ability to navigate the Bible, as players may freely reference their Bible throughout the game.

197303.name: Backstab (Issue 36 - Dec 2001)
rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (2nd Edition)

197304.name: Heroes of Equestria 4th Edition
197304.description:
From publisher blurb:

The magical land of Equestria is now yours to explore in this Dungeons & Dragons inspired tabletop RPG. Based off of My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic, this game will provide everything you need to play a game within the world of the show. When I wrote this game, my first priority was versatility. You can play a slice of life adventure or a more traditional adventure with swords and sorcery. The rules are also written as clearly as possible, but still provide a lot of flexibility for changes and additions. This is a game that is accessible to newcomers and advanced players alike and with detailed lists for abilities, monsters, magic, and items, there's plenty to give you ideas.

New to the 4th edition: Wow, forgive me for bragging, but I have really outdone myself with this update. Many elements of the game has been rebalanced or heavily edited, some new rules and features have been added, several mistakes have been corrected, and overall, I feel have a much more solid game now than when I long since started. The list below is only a small sampling of the changes and improvements I’ve made this game. If you haven't played my game yet, now is the best time to do it.

I can’t believe it took me so long to realize a major mistake I’d made with the armor. You see, in previous editions, I had given PCs the option to wear armor made of leather and dragon hide. But as I was writing the fourth edition, it suddenly occurred to me that ponies, who are vegetarians, probably would object to the idea of wearing leather. Oops! I derped. So I’ve redesigned padded armor so that it supersedes leather armor, I’ve deleted dragon hide armor from the list, and readjusted the stats of all the other armor to compensate.
For ranged weapons and spells “5 feet per Agility/Mentation” used to be the standard range. Now, almost all ranged weapons and spells have a range of “10 feet per Agility/Mentation.”
The Telekinetic Spear feat has been deleted. New feats have been put in such as Telekinetic Crush, Magical Energy Beams, and Magical Energy Rays to replace it.
Characters from Daring Do’s adventures (including Ahuizotl, his henchmen cats, Talicon warriors, and Daring Do) have been removed from Alternate Version Characters and have been placed in the actual list of canon characters in this book
The Talk to Animals feat has been deleted. If a PC wants to be able to talk to animals, they must learn the Faunal language by obtaining a level in the Linguistics skill. The Magic Surge feat has been deleted and replaced with the Quicken Spell.
For those of you who want to play as a thief or as a bard, I’ve made some changes to feats essential to those classes. The Bard Songs feat has been edited so that bards no longer have to roll the dice just to successfully play a song. I also edited the instructions to the Sneak Attack feat and the Stealth skill so they’re clearer.
Under character creation, starting skill points, Aptitude points, and HP has been rebalanced for alicorn level characters so it is fairer to adult and foal level characters.

197305.name: Pony Tales (Revised)
197305.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pony Tales is a role-playing game for ages twelve and older, written in a straightforward conversational style and streamlined for ease of play. The game is available as a free PDF file for download in two sizes, US letter and A4.

A chief feature of the game is its differentiation between "literal" games, which take the show's anachronisms and inconsistencies at face value, and "figurative" games, which assume those elements are exaggerations or simplifications for effect. Where possible the rules make allowances for both kinds of games, offering suggestions and alternatives to suit the different styles of play.

The book is split into parts. Part one covers the basic rules of the game. Part two adds information and extra rules that are helpful but not absolutely or constantly necessary. Part three discusses the setting of the television program, both as the show’s creator originally imagined it and as it’s ended up in actual episodes. Part four offers suggestions and ideas for playing a fun and exciting game. At the end of the book is a quick reference of tables to look up things during a game session.

197306.name: Backstab (Issue 37 - Jan 2002)
rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (2nd Edition)
197306.description:
Backstab
Nombre 37
Janvier 2002

Spécial Vaudou: de bien jolies poupées

197307.name: The Magical Land: Equestria and Its Environs - An Examination of World-Building
197307.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Magical Land examines the setting of My Little Pony Friendship Is Magic and relates it to the real world, expanding on the history and technology of the Industrial Revolution. In particular, based on published comments by and interviews of the show's creator and staff, it focuses on the late nineteenth century, during the heyday of the steam locomotive and before electricity became common.

197309.name: Backstab (Issue 38 - Apr 2002)
rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (2nd Edition)

197310.name: Workhorses
197310.description:
From publisher blurb:

The workhorses get it done!

Ships of Clement Sector 10-12 compiles in print the tenth, eleventh and twelfth volumes of our popular PDF series. Included within this book are the Lee-class merchant vessel, the Fedpost mail courier, and the Broken Hill-class Prospector. We have also included the Wraith-class Intruder and the Venture-class Troop Transport, variants of the courier and the prospector respectively.

Each ship is beautifully detailed with multiple views, detailed deckplans and full statistics. Also included are several NPCs and adventure hooks to get these vessels quickly and easily into your campaign.

While each of these ships has been specifically designed to fit into the Clement Sector setting, they could easily be used in other Traveller settings or within other science fiction RPGs if needed.

Get on board! Adventure awaits!

197311.description:
Byle do pierwszego is a board game filled with humor and satire, but primarily build on an attractive mechanics of repaying bills. Yes, it is the bills that are the biggest challenge for the players (3 to 5). If you like fast and dynamic games with quick setup and low downtime, with a significant role of interaction, then this is a game for you!

In Byle do pierwszego players control 6-persons families trying to survive two months in the homely housing estate.
They start a game with certain amount of money and a set of bills, which values are between 50 and 400 zł. By the end of each month, which passage is marked on a special calendar with 12 months to choose from, players must get rid of all bills.
With proper management of family members, which can be sent to several premises on the board, players are able to gain valuable discounts that will allow them to deal with the debts.
A great help (but a chore for rivals) are 3 types of action cards, which players earn after paying the bill. The higher the amount to pay, the better the deck from which the player draws an action card. And how much payment a player will get on hand the first day of the month will depend on its position on the career track.
Each turn, a player is faced with the question "career or family?". The player who after two months of fighting will have the most nest-eggs will win Byle do pierwszego.
197311.name: Byle do pierwszego

197312.name: Rolling Sun
197312.description:
Rolling Sun has a gameplay based on CRYENGINE’s physics with a horizontal scrolling camera in 3D environments. In this game you must lead your ball from left to right but also in depth depending on the obstacles and tracks.

Throughout your adventure, you play as a ball of magic stone representing the Sun God on Earth. Your goal is to counter the plans of your rival, the moon god. To do so, the sun gave you skills to help you. Such as a double jump, power planner etc …

During this adventure, you travel through a magical world where poetry and magic will be present.

Source: The Developer Website.

197313.description: This ship is the competitive prize for "The Trouble With Tribbles" episode Organized Play event. It is a Klingon D7 class ship.
197313.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Kohlar's Battle Cruiser
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

197317.description:
This was given out as a participation prize for the Peak Performance episodic tournaments.

It contains:

1 Alternate art Planet Token
197317.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Peak Performance Organized Play Scenery and Tokens

197320.description: A Handful of Stars is the final title published by Treefrog Games and the third entry into the unofficial "A Few Acres of Snow Trilogy." The first game was the two-player A Few Acres of Snow, whose main mechanisms were then reimplemented in the multiplayer Mythotopia, and now A Handful of Stars reimplements the mechanisms from Mythotopia and takes them to the vast reaches of space...
197320.name: A Handful of Stars
boardgamepodcastepisode: Heavy Cardboard Episode 57 – Princes of the Renaissance
HLG 10: Meer Essen
WTG6 - Board Game Leftovers Podcast : Arkham Horror LCG and Legends of the American Frontier

197321.name: Cult Following
197321.description: Cult Following is a creative storycrafting card game. Each round two or three players are selected to be cultists. All the other players are designated as recruits. Cultists choose three ideas from a hand of five cards and creatively bind them together into a ridiculous cult. Recruits draw cards with questions and choose one to ask the cultists to help them figure out which cult to join. Each cultist takes a turn to answer. The recruit then picks their favorite answer and gives that cultist their question card, which represents a new follower that has joined that cult. The first cultist to reach two followers wins the round.

197322.name: Children's Crusade
197322.description:
Publisher's blurb:

We are pleased to present the first entry in a new series of monthly PDFs for the Fantasy AGE RPG. Fantasy AGE Encounters are short “side quests” that can be used as is or expanded into longer adventures.

In Children’s Crusade, our heroes come across a group of children beset by bandits. But bandits turn out to be the least of their worries, and it’s difficult to know if all is as it seems…

a fantasy age encounter for heroes of levels 1-4

197323.name: Town Squares
197323.description:
From the publisher:

“Four noble houses compete for land in a struggle of power and glory. Strategically claim your territory while obstructing your enemies as you fight for reigning dominance. Use the grid to your advantage and become victor in the game of Town Squares.”

Town Squares is a card game for 2-4 players. It’s a fun, easy to learn, competitive strategy game in which players take turn placing cards to earn points while at the same time taking points away from others.

As the decks are shuffled each time, and you get to decide where you are placing them in the layout of the game, every game is different and individual. You will never play the same one twice.

Games with 2 players tend to be fast and furious - about 5 to 10 minutes in length. More players add to this time and games with 4 players can be from 10 - 20 minutes in length. You could have a quick game anywhere you like as it’s highly portable: on a table at a cafe, on a coffee table at home, or on a blanket at the beach.

197324.name: The Seers (2013)
197324.description:
User summary:

The game is distributed as a PDF file for print-and-play, creating a deck of cards. Play involves distributing character cards and then following the instructions on the cards. Occasional reference is made to a draw from the Major Arcana of a Tarot deck. However, if the custom game cards or a Tarot deck are not available for play, a standard stripped pack of French playing cards and 4d6 may be substituted, using a reference table to determine substitutes.

197325.description:
Factory Funner: Expansion 1 is a small promo expansion to Factory Funner containing:


Filtrator - A new machine.
Secret Lab 51 - Another new machine that can be built over by connectors.
A 2-hex factory floor extension.
A pillar to handicap advanced players.
197325.name: Factory Funner: Expansion 1

197326.description:
With this expansion of GAMBONI, you can play with a 6th player. The goal of the 6th player is to STOP all other players or to GET RICH while "helping" them (taking bribes).

There are three characters in RICO:


The Police Chief, special ability: Reclaim territory for the city (max 5 spots)
The FBI agent, special ability: Play an FBI card of choice.
The Federal judge, special ability: Raise or lower any player's bail (max 5 pts).


The expansion contains 3 new character cards and a set of simple instructions.

The 6th player wins the game if he manages to get all other players down to the "Street Thug" level on the score ladder, or when collecting a certain sum of cash.
197326.name: RICO: 6th player expansion for GAMBONI

197327.name: Mercado Sustentável
197327.description: Mercado Sustentável is a roll and move, buy/sell stock game. At each space on the board the players can buy companies, pay fees, receive dividends or pay debts to creditors (other players). In some areas, however, the players can purchase 4 types of certificate cards ("market", "Technology", "social" and "environmental") so that each time other players lands on one of your companies, you can exchange a certificate card for a certificate chip, upgrading your company. Whenever another player lands there the company owner must pay dividends for the company certificates of others players. During the game, players can also adquire charges or dividends cards, which provide information on sustainable business growth. When only one player remains in play, exhausting all resources of other players, he or she is the winner of the game.

197328.description: 1916: Romania, Battle of Nations is a comprehensively researched operational-level game that explores the intriguing campaign fought in and around Romania from August to December 1916. The campaign was unique for the Great War as it featured sweeping advances by both sides, and effective use of cavalry forces. The game system employed is inspired by Mike Resch's "1914" series, with variations and special rules for the theater of war and the year 1916.
197328.name: 1916: Romania, Battle of Nations

197329.name: Caça ao Mosquito da Dengue
197329.description: In Caça ao Mosquito da Dengue players are trying to prevent Dengue fever from spreading by finding nests of mosquitos on opponent's headquarter. Each round, on the player's turn, he guesses where the nest could be at the other's grid by saying a combination of color and number, if you miss, the opponent marks the area with "X", and pass his turn. If guess is correct he marks the combination on his grid to complete the object (rail, vessel, tire, water tank or bottle) receiving the correspondent card. Victory goes to the player who collect 5 different kind of cards first, and the others continue to set the 2nd and 3rd places.

197330.name: Gothic Heroes
197330.description:
From the Introduction:

This month, Unearthed Arcana takes a look at a few new character options appropriate to gothic horror. The revenant subrace provides an interesting way to bring a character back from the dead - a useful option if you've lost a character in the mists of Barovia. The Monster Hunter and the Inquisitive are two new archetypes for the fighter and rogue, respectively, well suited to the challenges of Ravenloft or any other gothic horror campaign.

197332.name: THE STRANGE: Cypher Chest
197332.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Created as game aids to easily randomize and track transient items, The Strange Cypher Deck, XP Deck, and Creature Deck are among the best-selling PDF products for the line. Now they're available through retail, in a single well-priced, easy-to-shelf package! The three decks come in a sturdy rigid box, sized to sit neatly alongside The Strange books on your RPG shelves. The internal tray holds the three existing decks, with room to store future expansions. The Cypher Deck allows GMs and players to randomly generate single-use cyphers on the fly. Each of the 100 power cards offers multiple power options, while 20 form cards describe the item's appearance in each of six possible recursion laws. The XP Deck provides a set of tangible tokens to represent experience points-a sort of game currency that often changes hands between players. The Creature Deck contains 100 commonly encountered creatures. Draw a card to quickly build an encounter: One side has basic stats (with a reference to the book for full stats and info), and the reverse has an image to share with the players.

197333.description:
HUMANS AND ALIENS COLLIDE ON WORLDS ERASED FROM EXISTENCE

ENTER THE DEADZONE!
In the future, unthinkably powerful mega-corporations own and govern entire planets outright, protecting their interests with vast, private armies. Now, an even greater danger is sweeping the galaxy * a hideous mutagen wiping out entire sectors of space. To stem the carnage, highly classified Containment Protocols are enacted, blockading the infected system and wiping it from navigational charts forever. Here, with the veil of civilisation lifted, rival factions descend into furious conflict, each with a unique claim on the chaos of the Deadzone!

CHOOSE YOUR SIDE!
Deploy elite Enforcers to mercilessly hunt down the rampaging Plague army as it surges ceaselessly towards total contamination; Oversee the ransacking of abandoned districts by the hulking Marauders as the terrifying Veer-Myn single-mindedly set about bolstering their own numbers; Plunder natural resources with the tech-heavy Forge Fathers as the eclectic Rebs scavenge for discarded gear, or simply scheme in secret as the mysterious Asterians pursue goals known only to themselves. As your collection grows, where will your loyalty lie?

PREPARE TO DEPLOY!
A tabletop wargame without the hassle, Deadzone strips away unnecessary complications leaving you free to enjoy the excitement and tactical depth of futuristic battle. Starter armies of two rival factions are included in this set, kicking-off your collection of Enforcers and Forge Fathers, along with everything else 2 players need to get right into the action. Assemble your finely detailed miniatures and get ready for fast paced, easy to learn, mission-based skirmishes in a brutal future!
197333.name: Deadzone (2nd Edition)

197334.description:
From the publisher:

The element of water is universally considered to bring life, except in this case. Deep within the oldest mountains of the north, where the bitter cold freezes water in an instant, Iao was born. Encasing itself in a metal from a lost age it wields shards of Kelemite as a giant mace. The intense cold that radiates out from Iam freezes any heroes foolhardy enough to get into close range. This expansion requires Myth base game.
197334.name: Myth: Iao Captain Pack

197335.name: Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Slum Quarter
197335.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Survive in sin city! Whether your party's tracking a gang of notorious thieves or hiding out from the law themselves, no Game Master wants to spend time drawing every cluttered alley and squalid flophouse. Fortunately, with Paizo's latest Pathfinder Flip-Mat, you don't have to! This line of gaming maps provides ready-to-use fantasy set pieces for the busy Game Master. Full of beautiful details, including a battered gatehouse, dozens of hovels, and mazelike backstreets, this double-sided map makes the perfect setting for forays into any city's seamier side! Don't waste your time sketching when you could be playing. With Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Slum Quarter, you'll be prepared next time your players head to the wrong side of town!

197336.name: Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Bigger Tavern
197336.description:
Publisher Blurb:

It Comes in Pints! Step into a tavern complex complete with rooms for travelers, extensive stables, and a forge for those wanderers who need to replace their weapons-the possibilities for adventure are endless with Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Bigger Tavern. With an area that's a whole 45% larger than Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Tavern at their disposal, Game Masters can now dream even bigger! This massive gaming accessory presents both exterior and interior views of this roadside way station, which can be either a sanctuary where weary travelers can restock or a trap for unwary adventurers. Don't waste your time drawing every pub table and inn room. With Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Bigger Tavern, you'll be ready the next time your players belly up to the bar!

197337.name: Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Twisted Caverns
197337.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Twist and Shout! Whether your party is venturing into a maze of twisty passages or escaping from the creature that dragged them to the center of its distressingly bone-strewn lair, no Game Master wants to spend time drawing every narrow cave tunnel and dead end. Fortunately, with Paizo's latest Pathfinder Flip-Mat, you don't have to! This line of gaming maps provides ready-to-use fantasy set pieces for the busy Game Master. Full of beautiful details, including a fungus-infested cave and a spiraling descent, this double-sided map makes the perfect setting for encounters in the dank and dark! Don't waste your time sketching when you could be playing. With Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Twisted Caverns, you'll be prepared next time your players head underground!

197338.name: Iconic Equipment 3
197338.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Claim the gear of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game's most famous heroes, from the arcanist and shaman to the war priest and brawler, with the Iconic Equipment 3 Item Cards! This 54-card set of beautifully illustrated, full-color Item Cards lets you add a whole new dimension to your game and show your players all the loot they find during their adventures! Each card includes note space on the back, allowing players to keep track of what they know about their treasure. Item Cards are designed for the Pathfinder RPG, but are usable with any fantasy roleplaying game.

197339.name: Conversion Notes for "The Accursed Tower"
197339.description:
From the introduction:

The original The Accursed Tower adventure module was released by TSR in 1999, right at the last gasp of 2nd Edition D&D. Written by R.A. Salvatore & The Seven Swords (Salvatore’s gaming group), the adventure features cameo appearances by two of Salvatore’s famous characters from his novels, Regis the Halfling and the dark elf Drizzt Do’Urden. The adventure is split into three sections: a largely uneventful caravan journey from Luskan to Icewind Dale; researching the background information and location of the main dungeon; and the eponymous dungeon itself – a sunken tower occupied by a host of cursed undead and a dangerous array of traps.
...
This conversion document requires that you have a copy of The Accursed Tower
...
This conversion gives DMs guidelines on converting the module to D&D 5th Edition rules and advice on adventure preparation.

197340.name: Kumoon: Ballistic Physics Puzzle
197340.description:
Naksu the boxstacking robot is sick of his job and starts knocking the boxes over. How elegantly can the deconstruction be performed?

Kumoon is the antithesis to the interminable block-movement puzzle. The blocks here are just to be knocked over. Their glowing light numbers indicate their value, which increases as you ricochet your projectiles around the room.

Source: The Game Website.

197341.name: Il Dominio della Follia
197341.description:
From the introduction:

L'associazione d7 - GdR in Sardegna, vi presenta l'avventura originale alla base del Torneo Il Dominio della Follia de D&D 5° Edizione. In un formato giocabile per un gruppo di avventurieri dal 3° al 6° livello, questa folle avventura vi fornirà anche personaggi pre-generati per una parteza immediata in un'epico cataclisma nell 'Amm dei Regni Dimenticati!

User summary:
